title: Structure of the antiplasmodial compound 7,9-dinitrocryptolepine hydrochloride methanol solvate.
abstract:
noThe structure of C16H10N4O4[HCl,1.5CH3OH],\ud
Mr = 406.80, has been determined from X-ray diffraction\ud
data. The crystals are monoclinic, space group C2/c, with\ud
eight molecules per unit cell and a = 21.482(4),\ud
b = 7.131(1), c = 24.495(5) A ° , b = 111.01(3) , crystal\ud
density Dc = 1.546 g/cm3. The material was difficult to\ud
crystallize and crystals produced were found to be poor\ud
diffractors. Intensity data were measured at liquid nitrogen\ud
temperature using a weakly diffracting crystal typical of\ud
the batch. However the X-ray analysis has finally enabled\ud
the chemical constitution of this cryptolepine derivative,\ud
which was previously incorrectly assigned, to be\ud
unequivocally established. Direct methods were used to\ud
solve the structure which was refined by full-matrix least\ud
squares to a conventional R-index of 0.0798 for 2,861\ud
reflections and 268 parameters. The 7,9-dinitrocryptolepine\ud
molecule is highly planar with a strong intramolecular\ud
hydrogen bond between N(10) in ring C and O(92) of a\ud
nitro group. There are a number of intermolecular hydrogen\ud
bonds involving the cryptolepine derivative the\ud
hydrochloride and both solvated methanols. One of the\ud
methanol solvate molecules (methanol 2) is unusually\ud
disordered with its C atom lying exactly on a crystallographic\ud
twofold axis. Consequently the methanol OH and\ud
H3 groups are at 0.5 occupancy and repeated by the twofold\ud
symmetry

Structure of the antiplasmodial compound 7,9-dinitrocryptolepine hydrochloride methanol solvate.</dc:title><dc:creator>
Lisgarten, John N.</dc:creator><dc:creator>
Potter, B. S.</dc:creator><dc:creator>
Pitts, J. E.</dc:creator><dc:creator>
Palmer, R. A.</dc:creator><dc:creator>
Wright, Colin W.</dc:creator><dc:subject>
Cryptolepine</dc:subject><dc:subject>
Malaria</dc:subject><dc:subject>
Crystal structure</dc:subject><dc:subject>
Antiplasmodial</dc:subject><dc:description>
no</dc:description><dc:description>
The structure of C16H10N4O4[HCl,1.5CH3OH],\ud
Mr = 406.80, has been determined from X-ray diffraction\ud
data. The crystals are monoclinic, space group C2/c, with\ud
eight molecules per unit cell and a = 21.482(4),\ud
b = 7.131(1), c = 24.495(5) A ° , b = 111.01(3) , crystal\ud
density Dc = 1.546 g/cm3. The material was difficult to\ud
crystallize and crystals produced were found to be poor\ud
diffractors. Intensity data were measured at liquid nitrogen\ud
temperature using a weakly diffracting crystal typical of\ud
the batch. However the X-ray analysis has finally enabled\ud
the chemical constitution of this cryptolepine derivative,\ud
which was previously incorrectly assigned, to be\ud
unequivocally established. Direct methods were used to\ud
solve the structure which was refined by full-matrix least\ud
squares to a conventional R-index of 0.0798 for 2,861\ud
reflections and 268 parameters. The 7,9-dinitrocryptolepine\ud
molecule is highly planar with a strong intramolecular\ud
hydrogen bond between N(10) in ring C and O(92) of a\ud
nitro group. There are a number of intermolecular hydrogen\ud
bonds involving the cryptolepine derivative the\ud
hydrochloride and both solvated methanols. One of the\ud
methanol solvate molecules (methanol 2) is unusually\ud
disordered with its C atom lying exactly on a crystallographic\ud
twofold axis. Consequently the methanol OH and\ud
H3 groups are at 0.5 occupancy and repeated by the twofold\ud
symmetry.</dc:description><dc:date>
